channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Five Quotes from Financial History to Guide Trustees
item.description: If you serve as a trustee of an institutional investment plan, these five quotes may help guide your decisions for the benefit of those who depend on your stewardship.

item.title: Live Nation reveals ‘a criminal threat actor’ offered to sell Ticketmaster data on the dark web, while reports say hackers seek $500,000 for customer info
item.description: The data reportedly includes names, addresses, phone numbers and some credit card details of millions of Ticketmaster customers.

item.title: Stocks for the Long Run? Setting the Record Straight
item.description: Stocks are a good investment long-term, providing that you dial in your expectations. New historical findings provide a richer, more complete understanding of international returns.

item.title: The housing market is finally seeing more inventory, but buyers aren’t showing up as a ‘cold reality is settling down’
item.description: “Without the rate cuts, a cold reality is settling down on the housing market,” Robert Frick, corporate economist for Navy Federal Credit Union, said.

item.title: Rethinking Retirement Planning Amidst Aging Demographic Frontiers
item.description: Forward-thinking approaches to policy and wealth management are needed to ensure a better financial future across generations and income brackets.

item.title: The best-performing stock on the S&P 500 is a ‘unicorn’ that joined the index less than a month ago and is beating Nvidia
item.description: Vistra’s mix of gas and nuclear power plants make it “a unicorn,” according to Guggenheim’s Shahriar Pourreza.

item.title: Book Review: The New World Economy in 5 Trends
item.description: A diligent economist and an eclectic bookworm serve up an analysis of megatrends that will have the greatest impact on economies and investments: innovation, productivity, climate, multiglobalization, debt, and aging.

item.title: The ANC party that freed South Africa from apartheid loses its 30-year majority, signaling first-ever coalition government to come
item.description: With more than 99% of votes counted, the once-dominant ANC had received just over 40% in Wednesday's election.

item.title: Factor Strategies Belong in Your Completion Portfolio Toolkit
item.description: Why wouldn't you include factor strategies in your completion portfolio? A review of the two commonly used approaches for managing institutional assets highlights their symbiotic nature.

item.title: Jerome Powell's Federal Reserve is stuck in a self-defeating paradox that makes cutting rates more difficult, economist warns
item.description: "You can call this the Fed Cut Reflexivity Paradox: The more the Fed insists that the next move in interest rates is a cut, the more financial conditions will ease, making it more difficult for the Fed to cut."
